previous: An essential requirement for the creation of an "official" altitude record is the employment of FAI-certified observers present during the record-setting flight.[1] Thus several records noted are unofficial due to the lack of such observers.
doc.after: On November 26, 2005, Vijaypat Singhania set the world altitude record for highest hot air balloon flight, reaching 21,290Â m (69,850Â ft). He launched from downtown Bombay, India and landed 240Â km (150Â mi) south in Panchale. The previous record of 19,811Â m (64,997Â ft) had been set by Per Lindstrand on June 6, 1988 in Plano, Texas.[citation needed]
